faqSection.title: Common Questions When Planning to Buy House in Rajendra Park Gurugram and Investment
faqSection.description: Get detailed and reliable answers to the most frequent inquiries about property ownership, legal checks, and residential living in the established Rajendra Park area of Gurugram.

faqs.question: Is Rajendra Park a good location for investment properties and high rental returns
faqs.answer: Yes, Rajendra Park is considered a highly stable and appreciating investment area in Gurugram. Its central location, excellent connectivity to industrial and corporate hubs like Cyber City and Udyog Vihar, and the presence of established infrastructure ensure consistent demand for rental accommodation. Independent houses here command good rental yields, particularly for properties structured as independent floors for multiple tenants. The security of freehold title further strengthens its long-term investment appeal for buyers.

faqs.question: What kind of legal documentation should I verify before I buy house in Rajendra Park
faqs.answer: Prospective buyers must rigorously verify several key documents. These include the original sale deed (and chain of title documents) demonstrating clear ownership history, the mutation records from the municipal corporation, and all necessary clearances like No Objection Certificates (NOCs) if the property has been recently constructed or heavily modified. It is essential to ensure the property is free from encumbrances, and that property tax receipts are up-to-date. We recommend utilizing a specialized property lawyer to conduct a thorough due diligence check.

faqs.question: Are the houses in Rajendra Park typically built under specific municipal guidelines
faqs.answer: As an established residential colony, houses in Rajendra Park are subject to guidelines set by the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG). Buyers should verify that the house construction adheres to approved building plans regarding setbacks, floor area ratio (FAR), and sanctioned number of floors. Unauthorised construction can lead to significant legal complications later. Our listed properties usually come with verified building approvals to ensure compliance and peace of mind for the buyer.

faqs.question: What are the common house configurations available for sale in Rajendra Park Gurugram
faqs.answer: The housing stock in Rajendra Park primarily consists of independent houses and Builder Floors. The most common configurations are 3 BHK and 4 BHK units, often spread across two or three floors. You can find houses ranging from efficient 900 sq ft built-up areas on smaller plots to large villas exceeding 3000 sq ft on larger plots. Many houses also feature dedicated servant rooms and ample parking space, catering to the needs of affluent urban families.

faqs.question: How is the connectivity of Rajendra Park to the major employment hubs in Gurugram
faqs.answer: Connectivity is one of Rajendra Park's greatest strengths. It offers quick access to NH-48 and major internal Gurugram roads. Cyber City and Udyog Vihar, two primary employment hubs, are easily reachable within a 15 to 25-minute drive depending on traffic conditions. Furthermore, proximity to the Gurugram Railway Station and easy links to Delhi via the main expressway make it a highly desirable location for working professionals across the NCR region.

faqs.question: Is it safe to live in the Rajendra Park area for families and senior citizens
faqs.answer: Rajendra Park is widely regarded as a safe and stable residential area. It benefits from well-maintained local law enforcement presence and an engaged residential welfare association (RWA) that ensures common security measures. The mature community structure means the streets are generally well-monitored by neighbors, providing a comfortable and secure environment particularly suitable for families with children and senior citizens.

faqs.question: Do I need RERA registration when buying a resale house in Rajendra Park
faqs.answer: If you are purchasing a ready-to-move, resale independent house that was completed and registered before the implementation of RERA, then individual RERA registration for that specific transaction is typically not required. However, if you are buying a newly constructed builder floor or a project launched after RERA implementation, you must ensure the project developer is RERA compliant. Always confirm the status with your legal advisor.

faqs.question: What are the water and electricity supply conditions like in this locality
faqs.answer: As an older, well-settled locality, Rajendra Park benefits from reliable municipal water and electricity connections, generally supplied by the MCG and DHBVN respectively. While borewell connections may exist, primary services are stable. Compared to peripheral sectors, infrastructure stability is high here, minimizing service disruptions and ensuring consistent utilities vital for daily residential life.

faqs.question: What amenities are close by like schools and hospitals
faqs.answer: Rajendra Park boasts excellent social infrastructure. Reputed schools like DPS, and major healthcare facilities like Sheetla Hospital and various multi-specialty clinics are located nearby. Residents enjoy easy access to local parks for recreation, several shopping centers, and banks, ensuring a high quality of life with essential services conveniently accessible.

faqs.question: Can foreign nationals buy house in Rajendra Park Gurugram
faqs.answer: Yes, Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) and Persons of Indian Origin (PIOs) are legally permitted to buy immovable property, excluding agricultural land or plantations, in India, which includes residential houses in Rajendra Park. However, foreign nationals of non-Indian origin generally require prior approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). Specific rules apply, so expert consultation is mandatory before initiating any purchase process.
